A multitude of incredible acts of bravery, from those of Sergeant First Class Alwyn Cashe , who suffered fatal burns pulling six of his soldiers from the wreckage of a burning Bradley vehicle in 2005, to the everyday courage of thousands of local Iraqis who showed up to work with coalition forces every day as interpreters and camp workers, despite the threats to them and their families by insurgent groups, despite that all too often, those threats weren't at all idle.
